title: Web Application Development 1
objectives: A short description of the course. Normally this will not be visible, unless the course is aggregated into a portfolio of modules

los.title: Assignment 1
los.objectives: Assignment 1 specification.

los.title: Assignment 2
los.objectives: Assignment 2 specification.

los.title: Assignment 2 tips
los.objectives: Version control during assignment 2, Locking your code.

topics.title: 1: CSS Framework
topics.objectives: Introduction to the Semantic UI CSS Framework

los.title: Semantic-UI I
los.objectives: An overview of the container and segments styles in the framework

los.title: Semantic-UI II
los.objectives: An exploration of the Grid and Image styles.

los.title: Semantic-UI III
los.objectives: An exploration of the Tables

los.title: Semantic Part IV
los.objectives: Our final tour of the Semantic-UI library - with a focus on icons, variations in segments and responsive grids

los.title: Lab-01a Semantic UI
los.objectives: Rebuild the web site using semantic-ui

los.title: Lab-01b Semantic UI
los.objectives: Continue to enhance the web site with additional Semantic-UI styles & Components

topics.title: 2: Glitch - Introduction to Glitch
topics.objectives: An introduction to the glitch platform + the very basics of the Javascript Language

los.title: Back End Scripting
los.objectives: Introduction to the concepts of Back End Scripting

los.title: Introducing Glitch
los.objectives: What is is, what role it plays, why was it built.

los.title: Glitch Tour
los.objectives: A look at at the components of a Glitch project. Also types of project will we build?

los.title: Glitch Features
los.objectives: The options available in a Glitch project + a an overview of the community projects

los.title: JS Introduction
los.objectives: Place javascript in its proper context, and explore its relationship to the browser.

los.title: Lab-2 Glitch Intro
los.objectives: Create, modify and view your first Glitch project.

topics.title: 3: JS - Variables, Boolean Logic & Objects
topics.objectives: Primitive JS types. Making decisions using selection statements. Simple objects.

los.title: Variables
los.objectives: Explore the javascript variables, including the basic types, conversion and usage

los.title: Boolean Logic
los.objectives: Boolean expressions, operators and selection statements

los.title: Const, Let & Objects
los.objectives: Using const & let. Declaring and using objects.

los.title: Variables & Objects Review
los.objectives: A concise tour of the structure of variables & objects in Javascript

los.title: Lab-3 JS Intro
los.objectives: Background & Tools, Variables & Boolean Logic

topics.title: 4: Glitch - Controllers & Views
topics.objectives: Build your first Glitch app, a simple static playlist web site.

los.title: Web App Introduction
los.objectives: Structure of a web app: Front-end Vs Backend. Routers, Models, Views, Controllers

los.title: Front-end
los.objectives: Views: Handlebars layouts, partials and templates

los.title: Modules
los.objectives: The backend will use a modular approach, relying on specific mechanism to import/export shared objects

los.title: Back-end
los.objectives: Server, routes + controllers

los.title: Lab-4 Glitch Playlist 1
los.objectives: Import and run a new starter project. Extend this project to include multiple 'views'. Explore the handlebars templating library.

topics.title: 5: Glitch - Templates & Routes
topics.objectives: Explore templating in more detail. Enhancing the routing behaviour.

los.title: Templates
los.objectives: Templates enable dynamic composition of views from layouts, partials and expressions.

los.title: JSON
los.objectives: JSON is notation for representing javascript objects in a simple literal format.

los.title: Dashboard
los.objectives: Review the dashboard controller in detail.

los.title: Playlist
los.objectives: Revise the Dashboard to render each playlist without their contents. Use a new playlist view to render individual playlists.

los.title: MVC
los.objectives: Explore the MVC Pattern in action in Playlist 2

los.title: Delete Song
los.objectives: How to remove a song from the playlist

los.title: Lab-5 Glitch Playlist 2
los.objectives: Refactor the dashboard controller to show summary of the playlists + link to show playlist details.

topics.title: 6: Custom CSS & JavaScript
topics.objectives: Add style and client-side code to the Playlist.

los.title: Delete a Playlist
los.objectives: This lecture will go through the steps for deleting a Playlist.

los.title: Styling your playlist
los.objectives: This lecture will explain how you can add your own CSS styles to your projects on Glitch.

los.title: Adding client-side JavaScript
los.objectives: In this lecture, we show you how to add client-side JavaScript to your projects on Glitch.

los.title: Forms Revision
los.objectives: This lecture provides a recap on HTML forms.

los.title: Playlist Forms Design
los.objectives: This section looks at the design of our forms for the playlist app.

los.title: Model View Controller
los.objectives: MVC is the guiding principle for the structure of our application.

los.title: Form Programming
los.objectives: How to accept user input from a form and process it in a controller

los.title: The Store
los.objectives: The Playlists are ultimately stored in a JSON file. This file is managed by database modules.

los.title: Lab-7 Glitch Playlist 3
los.objectives: Enable Songs and Playlists to be added via simple forms.

los.title: Arrays: Basics
los.objectives: Creating, accessing, adding to and removing from arrays.

los.title: Array Methods
los.objectives: Exploring length, slice, concat, join, indexOf, lastIndexOf

los.title: Array Iteration
los.objectives: Using for, while and do-while to iterate over an array

los.title: Arrays of Objects
los.objectives: Arrays of more complex data structures, including nested objects.

los.title: Update a Song
los.objectives: An overview of the how to update/change a Song record

los.title: Lab-8 JS Arrays
los.objectives: Array Basics, Array Methods & Iteration

topics.title: 9: Glitch - Sessions
topics.objectives: In order to implement user account management, sessions provide a mechanism for identifying specific users

los.title: Sessions Introduction
los.objectives: Keeping track of the currently logged in user is a challenge - as HTTP is, by definition 'stateless'. Hidden form fields, url rewriting and cookies are three common techniques for implementing sessions.

los.title: Using Sessions
los.objectives: Explore how we need to refactor the application to support sessions

los.title: Sessions UX
los.objectives: New forms needed to enable the user to signup / login

los.title: Creating Sessions
los.objectives: The API to create, access and destroy sessions.

los.title: Lab-9 Glitch Sessions
los.objectives: Introduce Sessions onto the Playlist application, enabling user accounts and cookie-based authentication.

topics.title: 10: Glitch - Images
topics.objectives: How to build an application that enables a user to upload and display images.

los.title: Cloudinary API
los.objectives: The fundamentals of the cloudinary service + API

los.title: Picture-store App
los.objectives: A review of the UX of the picture-store app

los.title: Picture-store Implementation
los.objectives: The Glitch app implementation.

los.title: Lab-10a Cloudinary Setup
los.objectives: Sign up and configure a Cloudinary Account.

los.title: Lab-10b glitch-picture-store
los.objectives: Build an application the can facilitate the upload and display of images in Glitch.

topics.title: 11: Glitch - Statistics and Helpers
topics.objectives: Implement simple statistics and helpers in the playlist app.

los.title: Statistics
los.objectives: This lecture will explain how to add some simple statistics to the playlist app.

los.title: Adding a Customised Helper
los.objectives: This lecture will explain how to add a simple customised Helper.
